p: Some extracts from green plants have been reported to fight against viral infections. Due to its rapid spread worldwide and the limited therapeutic options available to combat nCoV-19, the need to explore natural therapies cannot be over-emphasized. During the outbreak of SARS in 2002, China used a combination of traditional Chinese herbal medicine and western medicine, which proved effective in alleviating the symptoms of SARS ( Zhang et al., 2004). Herbal traditional medicine has been employed in the management and treatment of nCoV-19 infection. One report showed that 50 COVID-19 patients treated with the Chinese herbal drug Taijie Quwen granules significantly improved without any symptoms after 7 days ( Zhang, 2020). The study suggested Taijie Quwen granules reduced the occurrence of severe pneumonia in patients. In addition, a herbal concoction Qingfei paidu used to treat 214 COVID-19 patients in China yielded over 90% efficiency ( Zhang, 2020).
